messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Cons
messages.msgSnippet: ... Isn t there one in New jersey? I had a friend go last year and have been meaning to look into it this year. Stephanie E.
messages.messageBody:
> GWS used to have them in Boston. Where's the FUNschooling
> thing? Maryland?
> WAY down south somewhere? <g>

Isn't there one in New jersey? I had a friend go last year and have been meaning to look
into it this year.

Stephanie E.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling Cons
messages.msgSnippet: Providence has a main airport TF Green.  While we live in CT we fly out of there all the time (it s closer to us than Hartford s Bradley). Karen ... From:
messages.messageBody:
Providence has a main airport TF Green. While we live in CT we fly out of there all the time (it's closer to us than Hartford's Bradley).

Karen
----- Original Message -----
From: HMSL2@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, April 26, 2003 9:21 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling Cons




Just a thought but there is Pease International Tradeport. It is
the old Air Force base and has loads of space and buildings. They do have an
Airline that fly's in there also. I think it is Delta. There are Hotels on
the base, a bus line, the Mall less than 3 minutes and it is not a busy
location at all.
The Highway runs right past the base. They are just beginning over the past
couple of years to add more businesses.
<A HREF="http://www.peasedev.org/">http://www.peasedev.org/</A>
The Tradeport is about 20 minutes from Massachusetts on rt. 95.

Laura
Maine
I am willing to drive any where (CT, VT, MA, RI, PA, etc.) but wanted to
suggest a place I knew of away from the city's.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling Cons
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/26/03 5:34:42 PM, jana@coyotescorner.com writes:  Cheap
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/26/03 5:34:42 PM, jana@... writes:

<< Providence is less expensive - venues, hotels, restaurants, everything >>

Cheap airport is an important consideration. A secondary airport where you
have to fly somewhere else first can be prohibitive. A place where people
have to pay big bucks to park a car (like San Francisco; I don't know what's
like that in the northeast) would be problematical.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling Cons
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/26/2003 6:34:36 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I second that one, way too busy and if a hotel is needed much to costly. Laura [Non-text

> Personally, I would vote to have it somewhere other than Boston. Traffic,
> hotel rates, meal rates...all of that.
> Janis

I second that one, way too busy and if a hotel is needed much to costly.

Laura

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling Cons
messages.msgSnippet: I think around Boston - not in Boston - rates are way to high. WE have all of NE to choose from. Let s really take everything into consideration. Providence is
messages.messageBody:
I think around Boston - not in Boston - rates are way to high.

WE have all of NE to choose from.
Let's really take everything into consideration.
Providence is less expensive - venues, hotels, restaurants, everything
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: kayb85
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, April 26, 2003 5:53 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling Cons


I'm in Pennsylvania, not new England, but my brother lives in Boston
and I know how to get there. (Well, I know how to park at a train
station near Boston and have my brother meet me there and help me
take the subway into Boston! lol) A conference near or in Boston just
might be do-able for us!
Sheila

----- Original Message -----
From: KathrynJB@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, April 26, 2003 3:15 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Unschooling Cons


In a message dated 4/26/2003 3:06:29 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

>
> GWS used to have them in Boston. Where's the FUNschooling thing?
> Maryland?
> WAY down south somewhere? <g>
>
>

Oh, Julian and I went to the last one GWS did right as we started
homeschooling!

It was incredible! The workshops were wonderful, and the place was amazing.
Julian was just 8, and he had always pretty much been around an adult most of
the time all his life. There, however, he found things he wanted to do, and
met me at specific times. It was cool, because it felt safe to let him do
that, and he felt good. He spent one whole afternoon in a kayak, and fell in
love. Now he has his own, and it's still a passion.

What a cool conference that was!
Kathryn
